page.syntax: Result as P = Create_Indexes(C tablename ,C indexDef [,L showXbasic ])

argument.name: Result
argument.description: A pointer variable that contains the result of the operation. Result has the following properties:

item.name: . HasError
item.description: .T. = indexes could not be created .F. = indexes were created

item.name: . ErrorText
item.description: If .HasError is .T., then contains the error message.

item.name: . Xbasic
item.description: Contains the Xbasic code if Show_Xbasic is .T.

argument.name: tablename
argument.description: The name of the table containing the indexes to be created.

argument.name: indexDef
argument.description: A list of index definitions created by GET_INDEX_DEFINITIONS().

argument.name: showXbasic
argument.description: Logical. Optional. Default = .F. .T. = Show Xbasic code generated to create indexes.

page.description: Creates indexes for a table based on a CRLF definition string. Definition string is of format: tagname|OrderExpn|FilterExpn|Flags. Tip: The format string can be created using Get_Index_Definitions().
page.discussion: Creates indexes for a table based on a CR-LF delimited list created by GET_INDEX_DEFINITIONS().

section.title: Example
section.description: The following example retrieves index definitions from a table, then (after they were manually deleted), recreates the indexes.
section.example: list = Get_Index_Definitions("index_entries") ? create_indexes("index_entries", list, .t.) = ErrorText = "" HasError = .F. xbasic = t.index_create_begin("Entry","PADR(LEFT(ENTRY,40),40,\" \") + PADR(LEFT(SUBENTRY,40),40,\" \") + PADR(LEFT(TOPIC,40),40, \" \")","","") t.index_add("Index_Id","INDEX_ID","","U") t.index_create_end()
